texts.value: Protein kinase which influences neuronal morphogenesis and polarity through effects on microtubules. Regulates microtubule acetylation in neurons. Contributes to prolactin-mediated phosphorylation of PXN and VAV2. Implicated in prolactin-mediated cytoskeletal reorganization and motility of breast cancer cells through mechanisms involving RAC1 activation and phosphorylation of PXN and VAV2
Interacts with PXN, PRLR, VAV1 and VAV2 and this interaction is prolactin-dependent
Up-regulated in malignant versus normal breast tissue. Isoform 2 shows a high level of expression in testis, ovary and brain
Phosphorylation at Thr-479 regulates its catalytic activity
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. NEK Ser/Thr protein kinase family. NIMA subfamily

citation.title: Molecular cloning and characterization of the human NIMA-related protein kinase 3 gene (NEK3).
Complete sequencing and characterization of 21,243 full-length human cDNAs.
The DNA sequence and analysis of human chromosome 13.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Cell cycle-dependent expression of Nek2, a novel human protein kinase related to the NIMA mitotic regulator of Aspergillus nidulans.
Identification of 21 novel human protein kinases, including 3 members of a family related to the cell cycle regulator nimA of Aspergillus nidulans.
Novel association of Vav2 and Nek3 modulates signaling through the human prolactin receptor.
